subject: Programming
title: Ruby and Developer Happiness
description: A fast breakdown of Ruby and Developer Happiness for builders.

hook.text: Yukihiro Matsumoto believed programming should make developers genuinely happy.

buildup.text: He created Ruby in 1995, optimizing for human joy instead of machine efficiency.

discovery.text: Ruby let programmers express ideas in ways that read almost like natural sentences.

twist.text: Ruby stayed niche until Rails arrived in 2004, turning web development from months to days.

climax.text: Twitter, GitHub, and Shopify launched on Rails, proving happiness could scale.

punchline.text: A language designed for joy built the modern web.

quiz.question: What framework made Ruby popular for web development?
